description: The Hamilton Rotary Club met May 28 virtually with an amazing bagged lunch provided by the Colgate Inn. Tim Mansfield presented Friday Colgate University. Colgate, as stated by Hamilton Central School superintendent Bill Dowsland, also supported the school and gave much needed technology for students to finish online.
text:
The Hamilton Rotary Club met May 28 virtually with an amazing bagged lunch
provided by the Colgate Inn.

First on the agenda was a surprise birthday singalong for our foreign exchange
student, Augustina, led by incoming club president Lorna Wilson. Augustina
said she will miss Hamilton but after her two-week quarantine on arrival she
is excited to see her family and friends in Argentina!

Tim Mansfield presented Friday Colgate University. He stated that we are lucky
to have the incredible leadership of president Brian Casey and two task forces
working very long hours to make the many complicated decisions they face. Tim
said the school after refunding students gave an option to support Hamilton,
which many did by donating to the small business fund of the Partnership for
Community Development.

Colgate, as stated by Hamilton Central School superintendent Bill Dowsland,
also supported the school and gave much needed technology for students to
finish online. Through the Hamilton Initiative they have also tried helping
businesses with rent relief.

Mansfield said that though it is still unclear, the task forces are taking
every precaution and considering every effect of what will happen in the fall.

The club enjoyed the singing, the presentation, the food and the words from
Pastor Bill while visiting each other. We plan to announce our donation from
Rotary mug sales to Community Memorial next week and announce the service who
will be supported in the month of June.

New members are welcome to come join the group. Although meeting virtually
now, the Hamilton Rotary Club normally meets at noon every Thursday at the
Colgate Inn, 1 Payne St. in Hamilton.

title:
HAMILTON ROTARY CLUB NEWS

Rotarians wish exchange student a happy birthday
html:
The Hamilton Rotary Club met May 28 virtually with an amazing bagged lunch provided by the Colgate Inn.

First on the agenda was a surprise birthday singalong for our foreign exchange student, Augustina, led by incoming club president Lorna Wilson. Augustina said she will miss Hamilton but after her two-week quarantine on arrival she is excited to see her family and friends in Argentina!

Tim Mansfield presented Friday Colgate University. He stated that we are lucky to have the incredible leadership of president Brian Casey and two task forces working very long hours to make the many complicated decisions they face. Tim said the school after refunding students gave an option to support Hamilton, which many did by donating to the small business fund of the Partnership for Community Development.

Colgate, as stated by Hamilton Central School superintendent Bill Dowsland, also supported the school and gave much needed technology for students to finish online. Through the Hamilton Initiative they have also tried helping businesses with rent relief.

Mansfield said that though it is still unclear, the task forces are taking every precaution and considering every effect of what will happen in the fall.

The club enjoyed the singing, the presentation, the food and the words from Pastor Bill while visiting each other. We plan to announce our donation from Rotary mug sales to Community Memorial next week and announce the service who will be supported in the month of June.

New members are welcome to come join the group. Although meeting virtually now, the Hamilton Rotary Club normally meets at noon every Thursday at the Colgate Inn, 1 Payne St. in Hamilton.
